title: Annual Acquisitions and Disposals of Capital Assets

title.text: You are completing this for {ru_name} {conditional_trad_as}

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: This survey collects information that contributes to key economic indicators used by government and other key users to monitor and inform economic policy.
Data should relate to business activity, including foreign owned businesses, in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. It excludes the Channel Islands and Isle of Man.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.

questions.question: H. General and special purpose machinery and equipment

contents.description: This section asks for information regarding your business's value from acquisition of and proceeds from disposal of both general and special purpose machinery and equipment.
What we mean by 'general machinery and equipment'
General machinery and equipment refers to general purpose machinery and equipment that are used to facilitate production or provide services.
What we mean by 'special purpose machinery and equipment'
Special purpose machinery and equipment refers to specialised machinery and equipment that are used to facilitate production or provide services.
This section asks for information regarding the value from acquisitions of and proceeds from disposals of fabricated assets.

list: wood and products of wood and cork

contents.description: This section asks for information regarding your business's value from acquisitions of and proceeds from disposals of intellectual property assets. This refers to new protected information and specialised knowledge that are used to facilitate production.
This section asks for information regarding your business's value from acquisitions of and proceeds from disposals of all other capital assets.
Include all other capital assets that are used to facilitate production, not covered in earlier sections.

questions.question: L. Capital assets acquired under finance lease

contents.description: This section asks for information regarding your business's value from acquisitions of capital assets under a finance lease.
Capital assets you have reported in earlier sections, which are under finance lease and used to facilitate production or provide a service, must also be reported in this section.

questions.question: M. Period between payment and receiving capital items

contents.description: This section asks for information regarding any lags between paying for vehicles or other capital items and receiving these items.

contents.description: This survey collects expenditure on the acquisition, and proceeds from the disposal of capital assets that are used repeatedly to facilitate production, or provide services, for more than one year.
Information requested may not always be found on a register of capital assets, and should include all assets of any value, even if this is below your Asset Register threshold.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, can {ru_name} provide information regarding capital expenditure on major improvements and construction work?

definitions.title: Examples of major improvements and construction work

list: building and construction, including newly built, major renovations, improvements or extensions to existing buildings, for your own use
commercial, industrial, educational, health buildings, public monuments and other non-residential buildings
civil engineering work, including road and rail construction, runways, bridges, construction of power, communication, gas, pipelines and other utility projects, constructions for sport and recreation
specialised construction, including construction of oil wells, wind farms, turbines, tunnels, flood barriers and drains
land improvements, including land clearance, levelling, draining of marshes, creation of wells, demolitions and other land preparation that improves the quality, quantity and land productivity
costs associated with transfer of ownership of land such as land tax and land registry fees, excluding cost of land

structures that are used primarily as residences or dwellings, for example, houses, caravans and associated structures such as garages

What we mean by 'general machinery and equipment'
General machinery and equipment refers to general purpose machinery and equipment that are used to facilitate production or provide services.
What we mean by 'special purpose machinery and equipment'
Special purpose machinery and equipment refers to specialised machinery and equipment that are used to facilitate production or provide services.
